item.title: sveltekit-on-cloudfunctions
item.description: What about firebase-adapter-node? I was using this adapter for my project before sveltekit@1.0.0 came out. I think it works fine, but the problem is that it is always behind the current version of sveltekit.

item.title: add startup apps for popos
item.description: search for “Startup Applications” then click the add button and browse for the the appimage or, install the “Main Menu” app from the pop!

item.title: An open source Facebook groups alternative
item.description: Problem I donâ€™t use Facebook that much as a platform to share with the public. But, I do like the groups feature.

item.title: appimage
item.description: Appimages are standalone apps than can run on any linux distro. To make an appimage executable run this: chmod u+x <AppImage> or right click the appimage icon, go to properties -> permissions then check the Execute option.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Eight to Eleven
item.description: Taking a break The next scene for my 6 sketches project involves a city. I quickly realized that I don’t know how to do them.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Five
item.description: I feel like I learned a lot this week. I read “Framed Ink” in one day, might have gone through it too quickly.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Four
item.description: The problem that came up the previous week is my boring composition. Steven’s primary suggestion is to start with a horizon line.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week One
item.description: If you donâ€™t already know, I love art. I love looking at them, and I try to make my own as well.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Six to Seven
item.description: Week 6 So it has been two weeks trying to create 6 sketches based on a story. In the first week, I tried creating a story or just an outline of a story that I could use to determine what my 6 story points would be.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Three
item.description: I did more of the same exercises as the previous week. Still a bit unproductive though, I got hooked with playing “No Man’s Sky”.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Two
item.description: This week was unproductive. I tried my best to do the exercise but I struggled to get myself to put something on the canvas.

item.title: Art Update
item.description: It has been about 5 months since my last post. In that time, I’m kept on trying to improve my skills in art.

item.title: cargo-wix
item.description: cargo-wix is a tool to create windows installers. if there are multiple .exe files where main.exe depends on the others, a bundle can be created.

item.title: convoclips
item.description: Idea I like discord. I spend a lot of time on it and decreased my time on other social media. When I talk, I generally know who I’m talking to.

item.title: creating a mac installer
item.description: install builder uses click install app to build the installer but it’s too expensive dcp setup maker could another solution.

item.title: dev-notes
item.description: [[docker-compose]]

item.title: docker
item.description: website Docker is a tool that makes setting up environments for software to run on any platform reliably. It does this by packaging the source code along with all its dependencies defined in a [[Dockerfile]].

item.title: docker image
item.description: A [[docker]] container image is a lightweight, standalone, executable package of software that includes everything needed to run an application: code, runtime, system tools, system libraries and settings.

item.title: docker-compose
item.description: docs docker-compose is a tool that allows for management of multiple docker containers. It is basically a [[docker]] container container other subcontainers that makes it easy for the subcontainers to communicate with each other.

item.title: Dockerfile
item.description: reference A file for [[docker]] to follow with its build command to create a [[docker image]]. Here’s an example Dockerfile for serving a react app.

item.title: dockerhub
item.description: website A service that host docker images and manage versions. Functions similarly to github.

item.title: firebase auth
item.description: Firebase auth is free for without limit on the number of users. It could be a great option to use for new projects.

item.title: firebase withConverter
item.description: I’m trying to get correct types when I get data from firebase. withConverter docs Problem: 1 2 type User = {uid: string, .

item.title: First Brainstorm Classes
item.description: After Anthony Jonesâ€™ mentorship, I didnâ€™t know what to do next. I mentioned in my last post that I considered continuing the 6 sketches project suggested to me by Steven Zapata.

item.title: git submodules subtress
item.description: blog docs A way to manage cases where a project is needed within another project, and still be able to treat them as separate git repositories.

item.title: helix editor
item.description: I saw the zee “terminal” text editor but it was mainly inspired by emacs… not for me. Played around with it but I can’t live without my vim bindings.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hello World! I am finally writing a blog. Not that I haven’t tried doing it before, but its for real this time.

item.title: The fear of Failure

item.title: trunk
item.description: https://trunk.io/ Trunk simplifies checking, testing, and merging your code, allowing you to focus on writing features instead of babysitting PRs.

item.title: ubuntu set local time
item.description: Run this command especially for dual booting with windows to match the time format. Windows use local time while linux use utc by default.

item.title: unstyled components
item.description: Components that only handle the functionality of components and let the developers handle the styling. - react https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/react-aria/ https://www.downshift-js.com/ https://mui.

item.title: vim-copy-paste
item.description: Copying from vim to system clipboard is very useful. It can be tricky though. I only started using it recently, in reference to today’s date: 2022-04-04.

item.title: Watching time-lapse Art videos isn't good for you
item.description: I get it. Watching time-lapse videos of your favorite artists gives you a boost of motivation. It makes you want to paint your own ideas.

item.title: zod
item.description: docs Zod is a TypeScript-first schema declaration and validation library. I’m using the term “schema” to broadly refer to any data type, from a simple string to a complex nested object.
